table-wrap.anchoringText: Based on the typical thick heavy oil reservoir from Bohai offshore oilfield, China, we established a numerical model, as shown in Figure 2. The basic physical parameters of this model are shown in Table 1. The horizontal injector was placed 6 m above the producer. The water-oil relative permeability curve and liquid-gas relative permeability curve are respectively shown in Figure 3.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Basic physical parameters of simulation model

formatted-caption.caption-text: Basic physical parameters of simulation model

table-wrap.anchoringText: The parameters to impact the SAGD performance include reservoir parameters (thickness, porosity, permeability etc.), fluid parameters (movable oil saturation, oil viscosity, relative permeability etc.) and operation parameters (operation pressure, injection rate, steam trap etc.) (Barillas 2006; Gates and Chakrabarty 2006; Heidari et al. 2009; Hashemi-Kiasari 2014; Xu et al. 2014). Based on the numerical model above, using the orthogonal design method, we developed 50 orthogonal plans to analyze the influence of each parameter on SAGD performance. The parameters and levels are show in Table 2.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: The sensitive factors and level

table-wrap.anchoringText: These parameters include reservoir thickness (H), net-to-gross (NTG), movable oil saturation (ΔSo), horizontal permeability (Kh), Kv/Kh ratio, porosity (ϕ), oil viscosity (μo@50°C), operation pressure (P), steam injection rate (VS) and steam trap (TS). In this simulation model, we set the oil production rate less than 10 t/d as the drainage stop-condition. The 50 orthogonal test plans and simulation results are shown in Table 3. We collected the oil recovery factor, recovery rate and cumulative oil steam ratio (COSR) of each test plan. Then the grey relational analysis process is used to comprehensively evaluate the influence of each parameter and obtain the sensitive sequence.
table-wrap.label: Table 3
table-wrap.caption: The sensitive factors and level

table-wrap.anchoringText: Based on the grey relational analysis of the simulation results in Table 3, we can get the grey correlation of each parameters, as shown in Table 4. Thus, a sensitive sequence of each parameter to reflect the sensitive degree. From the grey correlation results of the three indicators in Table 4, we can see that the SAGD recovery performance is less influenced by the oil viscosity. For the recovery factor results of SAGD process, the influence of movable oil saturation is the most significant. For recovery rate, the influence of horizontal permeability is the most significant, and for COSR, the influence of porosity is the most significant.
table-wrap.label: Table 4
table-wrap.caption: The grey correlations and sensitive sequence of each parameters

formatted-caption.caption-text: The grey correlations and sensitive sequence of each parameters

table-wrap.anchoringText: In order to vidate the correlations above, in this section, we predict the SAGD recovery performance of a typical potential thick heavy oil reservoirs in Bohai oilfield using the correlations. LD block is a typical thick heavy oil reservoir in Bohai oilfield. The physical parameters of LD block are shown in Table 5.
table-wrap.label: Table 5
table-wrap.caption: The physical parameters of LD heavy oil block in Bohai oilfield

formatted-caption.caption-text: The physical parameters of LD heavy oil block in Bohai oilfield

table-wrap.anchoringText: In order to vidate the correlations above, in this section, we predict the SAGD recovery performance of a typical potential thick heavy oil reservoirs in Bohai oilfield using the correlations. LD block is a typical thick heavy oil reservoir in Bohai oilfield. The physical parameters of LD block are shown in Table 5. Using the linear correlation and nonlinear correlation above, we predicted the recovery performance of this heavy oil reservoir. The prediction results are shown in Table 6.
table-wrap.label: Table 6
table-wrap.caption: The prediction results of SAGD process in LD heavy oil block

formatted-caption.caption-text: The prediction results of SAGD process in LD heavy oil block

table-wrap.anchoringText: Furthermore, we also make a survey on some successful SAGD projects around the world, as shown in Table 7 and Table 8. Using the correlations we proposed above, we estimate the recovery performance of these SAGD projects. For some other variables (NTG, Sor, VS and Kv/Kh) which are not listed in Table 8, we adopt the same value for all of the cases to unify the influence of these parameters. The results are shown in Table 9.
table-wrap.label: Table 7
table-wrap.caption: Some SAGD projects around the world

formatted-caption.caption-text: Some SAGD projects around the world

Dates from 2003, two SAGD pilots, 50 operating wellpairs.
Jiang et al. 2013; Zhou et al. 2013; Wu er al. 2015.
Yang 2007; Pang et al. 2010; Bao et al. 2012.

table-wrap.anchoringText: Furthermore, we also make a survey on some successful SAGD projects around the world, as shown in Table 7 and Table 8. Using the correlations we proposed above, we estimate the recovery performance of these SAGD projects. For some other variables (NTG, Sor, VS and Kv/Kh) which are not listed in Table 8, we adopt the same value for all of the cases to unify the influence of these parameters. The results are shown in Table 9.
table-wrap.label: Table 8
table-wrap.caption: The reservoir properties of these SAGD projects

formatted-caption.caption-text: The reservoir properties of these SAGD projects

table-wrap.anchoringText: Furthermore, we also make a survey on some successful SAGD projects around the world, as shown in Table 7 and Table 8. Using the correlations we proposed above, we estimate the recovery performance of these SAGD projects. For some other variables (NTG, Sor, VS and Kv/Kh) which are not listed in Table 8, we adopt the same value for all of the cases to unify the influence of these parameters.
